pr_title: KAFKA-9557: correct thread process-rate sensor to measure throughput

timeline.message: MINOR: correct thread process-rate sensor to measure throughput

timeline.bodyText: We can still leverage on addInvocationRateToSensor here?
timeline.author: guozhangwang

replies.bodyText:
No, because we're specifically not measuring the rate of sensor.record(quantity) invocations, which means to count each record event as 1, regardless of quantity. Instead, we actually record the quantity now.
That sounds clear as mud to me, so here's an example:
Sensor S
* Metric A := invocation rate sensor
* Metric B := "plain" rate sensor

Execute: S.record(2) once in a second
State:
A.rate == 1/sec
A.total == 1
B.rate == 2/sec
B.total == 2

In this example, B is the definition we are aiming for.
replies.author: vvcephei

replies.bodyText: Yeah I know that :) I was referring to the one with SUM not COUNT too but I copied the wrong name. We already have a public addRateOfSumMetricToSensor which is only used for rocksDB today, and I was wondering if we can leverage that.
replies.author: guozhangwang

replies.bodyText:

I saw that metric, but had no idea what a "rate of sum" is... I fixed it now.

timeline.bodyText: I moved this into the tests where it was needed because it was interfering with the new tests, in which we specifically need the static method not to be mocked so that we can make sure that we are actually adding the desired metrics. The tests with this thing mocked only verify that ThreadMetrics invokes the static method on StreamsMetricsImpl, not that it actually creates the right metrics, but I don't have the ambition to fix the rest of the tests right now.
timeline.author: vvcephei

timeline.bodyText: I moved this into the block here because it makes no difference to the result, and it's a little more efficient.
timeline.author: vvcephei

timeline.bodyText: not a suggestion: We have a new metrics proposed in KIP-444 to report the ratio of processing each task within a thread (CPU wise), hopefully that helps with the debugging purposes.
timeline.author: guozhangwang

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I think the task-level latency metric would be the most useful. At the thread-level, it seems better to just report the total latency of all processing, so you could help debug the sources of poll latency or whatever, but it didn't seem like a good idea to just change it with no KIP.
replies.author: vvcephei
